revised_title: Isolation and Analysis of Nuclei from Animal Cells in Culture
tldr: Researchers developed a method to isolate nuclei from animal cells in culture, preserving their DNA and nuclear RNA. The isolated nuclei were free from adherent cytoplasm, and the process maintained over 95% of the DNA and nuclear RNA. This method allowed for further analysis of the nuclei's composition and provided insights into the cells' structure and function.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
